title: ICBC provides $28.6 million loan for 405 (3x135) MW Şırnak Silopi Thermal Power Plant Project
description: In 2010, ICBC provided a $28,612,000 buyer’s credit loan to Silopi Elektrik Üretim A.Ş. — a special purpose vehicle and a joint venture of Ciner Holding (85% ownership stake) and GSD Holding (15% ownership stake)— for the 405 (3x135) MW Şırnak Silopi Thermal Power Plant Project. This loan carried the following terms: a 13-year maturity and an interest rate of 2.465%. Its final maturity date is December 20, 2022. Sinosure provided the buyer’s credit insurance. The proceeds of the loan were to be used by the borrower to support the construction of second and third of the three 135MW power-generating units at the Silopi Thermal Power Plant in the village of Selçık within the district of Silopi and the provinces of Şırnak. China Machinery Engineering Corporation (CMEC) was the contractor responsible for implementation.   In 2004, a production license was obtained for the installation of the first 135MW power-generating unit and a contract was signed with CMEC. An Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA) report was received in 2005. After the contract with CMEC came into force in 2006, the construction and installation works were undertaken and the first 135-MW unit went online in May 2009. It was eventually decided to install 2 additional 135 MW units at the power plant. A second contract with CMEC, which went into effect in February 2011, supported the installation of these units. Unit 2 went into operation on May 8, 2015, and Unit 3 went into operation on December 18, 2015.
staff_comments: GSD Holding, a Turkish company, bought a 15% stake in Silopi Electricity Company (Silopi Elektrik) from Park Holding in 2015 for $125 million.  Also, note that there are conflicting reports about the amount of funding provided by ICBC. One source indicates that ICBC provided ‘account custody service’ for $220 million of export credits, which could be what was spent to buy 75.5% shares in Tekstil Bankası from GSD Holdings on May 22, 2015. The amount spent in Turkish dollars was 668,810,011.63 Turkish lira (TRY)
combined_text:
# Sector
ENERGY

# Title
ICBC provides $28.6 million loan for 405 (3x135) MW Şırnak Silopi Thermal Power Plant Project

# Description
In 2010, ICBC provided a $28,612,000 buyer’s credit loan to Silopi Elektrik Üretim A.Ş. — a special purpose vehicle and a joint venture of Ciner Holding (85% ownership stake) and GSD Holding (15% ownership stake)— for the 405 (3x135) MW Şırnak Silopi Thermal Power Plant Project. This loan carried the following terms: a 13-year maturity and an interest rate of 2.465%. Its final maturity date is December 20, 2022. Sinosure provided the buyer’s credit insurance. The proceeds of the loan were to be used by the borrower to support the construction of second and third of the three 135MW power-generating units at the Silopi Thermal Power Plant in the village of Selçık within the district of Silopi and the provinces of Şırnak. China Machinery Engineering Corporation (CMEC) was the contractor responsible for implementation.   In 2004, a production license was obtained for the installation of the first 135MW power-generating unit and a contract was signed with CMEC. An Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA) report was received in 2005. After the contract with CMEC came into force in 2006, the construction and installation works were undertaken and the first 135-MW unit went online in May 2009. It was eventually decided to install 2 additional 135 MW units at the power plant. A second contract with CMEC, which went into effect in February 2011, supported the installation of these units. Unit 2 went into operation on May 8, 2015, and Unit 3 went into operation on December 18, 2015.
justification: Project involves construction of thermal power plant units, which are typically coal-fired and contribute to fossil fuel dependency
evidence: 405 MW thermal power plant, three 135MW units, coal-fired technology implied by 'thermal' designation

title: China Foreign Languages Administration Donates Books to Turkish International Strategic Research Organization
description: On March 4, 2010, the Chinese International Publishing Group (a.k.a. China Foreign Language Publishing and Distribution Bureau) donated books to Turkish International Strategic Research Organization (USAK).The book donation ceremony was held in USAK's headquarters. The donated books and magazines cover Chinese politics, economy, culture and ethnic and religious policies. China International Publishing Group hopes to help USAK scholars understand and study China. The project has been coded as representational intent due to the material covered in the donated books.  USAK is one of the earliest established, largest, and most influential academic institutions in Turkey. It has a unique influence on the Turkish government's diplomatic decision-making. The Asia-Pacific Library is planning to build a library of 150,000 volumes, which will be the largest professional library for Asia-Pacific research in the Middle East, Transcaucasia, and Southern Europe.  The value of the donated books is unknown.
combined_text:

# Description

The donated books and magazines cover Chinese politics, economy, culture and ethnic and religious policies. China International Publishing Group hopes to help USAK scholars understand and study China. The project has been coded as representational intent due to the material covered in the donated books.  USAK is one of the earliest established, largest, and most influential academic institutions in Turkey. It has a unique influence on the Turkish government's diplomatic decision-making. The Asia-Pacific Library is planning to build a library of 150,000 volumes, which will be the largest professional library for Asia-Pacific research in the Middle East, Transcaucasia, and Southern Europe.  The value of the donated books is unknown.

evidence: Donation of books covering Chinese politics, economy, culture and ethnic/religious policies to academic institution

title: 2010 Donation of US $400,000-worth anti-malaria drugs batch 1 (Linked to #63793)
description: On January 18, 2010, the Chinese government donated over 244,000 doses of anti-malarial drugs worth 400,000 USD to Uganda. China's ambassador to Uganda, Sun Heping, handed over the donation of 144,000 doses of Arco and 100,000 doses of Duo-Cotexin to Richard Nduhuura, State Minister for General Duties in the Health Ministry.

title: Donation of medicine and equipment to China-Uganda Friendship Hospital
description: On November 13, 2014, the 16th Chinese medical team donated medicine and medical equipment worth 10 million RMB to the China-Uganda Friendship Hospital.  According to the exchange agreement signed on December 13 and December 27, 2010, the Chinese Government committed to providing a batch of medical equipment and supplies to the China-Uganda Friendship Hospital, including purifying air conditioners, pulse oximeters, ventilators, and manufacturing facilities. Oxygen machine, desk and other materials.

Oxygen machine, desk and other materials.

title: Chinese Government grants $598,175.56 for health sector activities
description: On October 25, 2010, the Chinese Government committed a grant worth $598,175.56 to the Government of Uganda. This grant is provided for general health sector activities. According to the Aid Management Platform (AMP) of the Government of Uganda's Ministry of Finance, Planning, and Economic Development, this grant has been fully disbursed.
